text: Ringgold Wilmer Lardner (March 6, 1885 â€“ September 25, 1933) was an American sports columnist and short story writer best known for his satirical takes on the sports world, marriage, and the theatre. Lardner was born in Niles, Michigan. He died of tuberculosis in East Hampton, New York. His son Ring Lardner Jr was a screenwriter who was banned from Hollywood in the 1950s for his Communist beliefs. He later won an Academy Award for writing the film MASH.
